Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (part of chest and one foreleg remaining) to right; squared cross and trace of possible elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The bull features on both Wild Goat Style and Mature Animal Style vases, but on the earlier style it is surrounded by more filling ornament than later.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0432) (phase 2)
